definition: the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound

sentences.english: Welcome to this scenic place, where you'll find an endless enjoyment for your holiday.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎光临风韵之境，给您的假日增添无穷乐趣。

sentences.english: In art, LI Guantong's novel has the Chinese classical esthetics the graceful bearing.
sentences.chinese: 在艺术上，李贯通的小说富有中国古典美的风韵。

sentences.english: Shekept her looks even in her old age.
sentences.chinese: 即使上了年纪，她仍然风韵犹存。

sentences.english: There is nothing more admirable than a handsome woman.
sentences.chinese: 再没有比风韵犹存的女人更值得赞赏的了。

sentences.english: Nicely honestly understands the life literacy training lofty graceful bearing I.
sentences.chinese: 善良正直懂得生活有文化修养高雅风韵的我。

sentences.english: But beautiful and Charm of the fertilizer.
sentences.chinese: 而是美丽和风韵的肥料。

sentences.english: It is not just about fabric or style. It also embodies a nation's culture.
sentences.chinese: 时装不仅是形和款，更是民族风韵和文化精神的体现。

sentences.english: Try to catch the elusive charm of the original in translation.
sentences.chinese: 翻译时设法把握住原文中难以捉摸的风韵。

sentences.english: The use of latinate words adds a tone of severity and dignity to this novel.
sentences.chinese: 拉丁语词汇的使用给这篇小说增添了严肃文雅的风韵。

definition: implicit charm in rhyme or sound/hinted appeal/interest
mien/bearing/grace/amorous feelings/flirtatious expressions/local conditions and customs/wind force, direction etc
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
to have quite a lasting charm
